other_tests.findings: Multiple gallstones and increased echogenicity of central liver and portal triads representing possible hepatitis. Gallbladder wall thickening. Negative Murphy's sign.
Large stone in the gallbladder with thickened gallbladder wall and surrounding fluid. CBD is dilated to 10 mm but an obstructing lesion could not be seen.
Right hemothorax post-treatment course of RFA.
